metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0799 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The fmtstr function in crypto/bio/b_print.c in OpenSSL 1.0.1 before 1.0.1s and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2g improperly calculates string lengths, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (overflow and out-of-bounds read) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a long string, as demonstrated by a large amount of ASN.1 data, a different vulnerability than CVE-2016-2842.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0799` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.1 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu2
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu2').
